articles.title: Pomminryon Issues Joint Resolution
articles.content:
Pomminryon Issues Joint Resolution

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The north, south and overseas headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued the following joint resolution on Sunday on the 21st anniversary of its formation:
					
					Today we significantly greet the 21st anniversary of the formation of Pomminryon, keeping deep in mind the cherished desire of all Koreans to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country as early as possible by national independence and great unity. 
					
					The formation of Pomminryon was a historic event as it helped the forces for national independence at home and abroad unite and set out on the unified patriotic movement. 
					
					By its formation the Koreans' movement for national reunification developed into a permanent three-way organized joint movement and the Korean nation has been able to work and struggle jointly while ensuring solid unity under the banner of the Three Charters for National Reunification. 
					
					Thanks to the three-way solidarity of Pomminryon and the banner of "By our nation itself" in the June 15 era, All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration could be formed and the reunification movement could turn into a nation-wide movement involving people from all walks of life. 
					
					After the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, the spirit of reconciliation and unity ran higher and the whole land of Korea was replete with patriotic emotion and will for reunification.
					
					But, no sooner had the Lee Myung Bak anti-reunification forces come to power than they totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. And they advocated "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars", "unification by absorption under liberal democratic system", "May 24 measures", "new establishment of tax for unification", etc., in a desperate efforts to turn the north-south relations advancing toward peace and unity back to the state of severance and confrontation. 
					
					Even they cooked up the case of sunken "Cheonan" warship during the Foal Eagle joint military exercises aimed at preemptive attack on the north in collusion with the imperialist warlike forces. Then they sparked off the Yonphyong Island shelling incident, driving the situation of the Korean Peninsular to the brink of war. 
					
					They totally banned visits, meetings for reunification and activities for national unity between people of different strata in the north and the south, which had been conducted legitimately in the June 15 era, and stopped all the north-south cooperation programs including tour of Mt. Kumgang, Mt. Paektu and historical relics in Kaesong. 
					
					Worse still, the anti-reunification security authorities have suppressed at random the just struggle of Pomminryon and other progressive and patriotic organizations for national reconciliation, peace and independent reunification, branding them as "enemy benefiting" on charges of "receipt of instructions" and "infiltration and escape". 
					
					We cannot but bitterly denounce this as a heinous treacherous crime to gag the overwhelming majority of popular masses desiring the implementation of the historic north-south joint declarations, bind them hand and foot and revive the Cold War era and ensure the stay in power of the separatist treacherous forces at any cost. 
					
					The historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the landmark for national reunification and guide common to the nation. 
					
					We will push ahead with the cause of building a prosperous and powerful, independent reunified country in the spirit of "By our nation itself" as we have paved the road for reunification despite harsh trials and difficulties in the way of the grand march for national independent reunification over the past 21 years. 
					
					Suppression invites struggle and victory is in store for the struggle for morrow of the nation. 
					
					The north, south and overseas headquarters of Pomminryon will support and promote the devoted efforts of the people from all walks of life for implementing the north-south joint declarations. We resolve as follows, with the steadfast and unanimous will to carry out the important task for building up the driving forces of the nation invariably under the banner of the Three Charters for National Reunification; 
					
					1. We will strictly preserve and implement the historic inter-Korean declarations.
					
					Implementation of the declarations ensures the rosy future of national reunification, and it represents genuine patriotism.
					
					In order to thoroughly defend and implement the declarations, it is unavoidable to struggle against the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad obstructive to this movement. 
					
					We, as befitting Pomminryon, invincible vanguard for reunification, will invariably take the lead in holding higher the banner of "By our nation itself" and firmly defending and enlarging the shining achievements made for national independence and unity. 
					
					2.  We will fully display the fighting spirit of Pomminryon to further strengthen the will of Koreans to open the gate to reunification. 
					
					To prevent visits and contacts between people of different strata and antagonize fellow countrymen will  spark confrontation and war.
					
					In order to open the gate to reunification, Pomminryon will conduct stubborn activities to pull down all barriers of confrontation including the "May 24 measures" and achieve the national reconciliation and reunification and, with the indomitable fighting spirit, resolutely stand against the security forces' anachronistic oppression being perpetrated by dint of the "National Security Law".
					
					In particular it will take strong counteractions to hold in check such war and confrontation moves as the joint military exercises with the outside forces and arms buildup being intensified day by day. 
					
					3. We will resolutely adhere to the tripartite solidarity and further strengthen the unity of the patriotic forces for reunification.
					
					The solidarity of Koreans in the north and the south and overseas is the lifeline of the reunification movement and the solidarity and unity of all patriotic pro-reunification forces is a treasured sword for victory.
					
					Pomminryon will hold a tripartite solidarity rally together with all political parties, organizations and personages at home and abroad with August 15 as an occasion starting in 2012 to further promote the nation-wide reunification movement and thus stand in the van of the struggle to open the gate to reunification.
					
					We will always put main stress on the viewpoint and attitude toward the north-south joint declarations in realizing the wide-range solidarity and unity and ensure cooperation for respect and unity, not for rejection and competition so that everyone can play the role of the true master of the tripartite solidarity.
					
					4. We will further expand Pomminryon.
					
					2012 is a year which will witness miracle and great change.
					
					The old should be removed and a fresh trend should appear to bring the future of the nation.
					
					We are sure that the "meeting for marking the 21st formation anniversary of Pomminryon and vowing to win in the two elections in 2012", held in the south today, will further strengthen the unity of the progressive forces and the solidarity and alliance of the patriotic forces aspiring reunification.
					
					The two elections, presidential and parliamentary elections to be held in south Korea, will be an important turning point in legitimating the reunification movement and bringing earlier the reunification under the June 15 declaration.
					
					Pomminryon, as an engine for great national unity and the vanguard in the movement for national independent reunification, will devotedly work hard to let the people desirous of independence and progressive reforms win in those two elections to be held in the south next year.
					
					The rosy future will be brought by unity, and when one stands in the van of struggle, the masses will follow one with trust and hope.
					
					Let all of us turn out in the plaza of struggle in the June 15 era for the victory of independent reunification with the indomitable mental power and ardent patriotic zeal by inheriting the historic resolution and spirit of the day when Pomminryon was formed and the glorious traditions of struggle established over the past 21 years.

articles.title: Dictatorial Crackdown Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Dictatorial Crackdown Slammed in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued a statement on December 14 in denunciation of the dictatorial forces' suppression.
					
					The police are nowadays intensifying the crackdown on the South Headquarters of Pomminryon while conducting search into its core members and pressmen over what is called "spyring case" and issuing warrants of arrest by dint of the "National Security Law", the statement charged.
					
					The Broadcasting and Communication Committee indicted the headquarters after finding fault with its Internet homepage, the statement pointed out, saying:
					
					Such crackdown is a foolish attempt to quell the growing anti-"government" sentiment.
					
					The people's aspiration for the country's reunification can not be checked with any slander against reunification activities and invention of farce, the statement said, calling upon all the people to turn out to sternly punish the present "government" and the "Grand National Party".

articles.title: Repeal of Humiliating FTA Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of Humiliating FTA Urged in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement held a press conference outside the building of the puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade on December 15, calling for the repeal of the humiliating FTA with the U.S.
					
					Speakers at the conference noted the chief for trade negotiations of the ministry recently asserted that they would try to make the FTA with the U.S. take effect within February next year.
					
					But, the authorities are refusing even to examine the contents of the "act for implementing the FTA" passed through U.S. Congress, they charged.
					
					The "Grand National Party" railroaded the motion calling for ratification of FTA and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade does not hesitate to do sycophantic and treacherous act by discussing in secrecy the procedures for putting the agreement in force, they pointed out.
					
					They demanded an immediate repeal of the FTA.

articles.title: Repression of Progressive Media Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Progressive Media Protested in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea, including the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and the People's Solidarity for Abrogation of the "National Security Law", held a rally in Seoul on December 15 in protest against the authorities' suppression of the progressive media.
					
					The ralliers recalled that the police made an investigation into a journalist of Jaju Minbo, an internet newspaper, by invoking the NSL on December 14.
					
					Such action committed over the north-related articles is a violation of freedom of speech, and this reveals despotism of the present "government", they said, adding:
					
					The object to be punished at present is not media advocating reunification but the conservative media inciting the north-south confrontation and war and the "Grand National Party" and Chongwadae keen in sycophancy toward the U.S. and Japan and treacherous acts, irregularities and obliteration of people's right to existence.
					
					The authorities have experienced a hot agony of shame internationally for getting hell-bent on the crackdown upon the progressive forces by dint of the NSL obstructive to independence, democracy and reunification, the ralliers charged, urging a prompt abrogation of the fascist law.

articles.title: Int'l Meeting Calls for Significantly Commemorating 100th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Int'l Meeting Calls for Significantly Commemorating 100th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The 13th International Meeting of Communist and Workers' Parties took place in Greece from Dec. 9 to 11 with the agenda of "Socialism Represents Future".
					
					Attending it were delegations and delegates of nearly 80 political parties from more than 60 countries including the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					The meeting adopted the following joint appeal:
					
					The communist and workers' parties and the progressive mankind of the world, together with the friendly Korean people, will meaningfully greet in April 2012 the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea and eternal president of the DPRK who made immortal contributions to the world history of politics in the 20th century and the human cause of independence.
					
					Penetrating deep into the requirements of the new era when the popular masses emerged as the masters of their own destinies, he fathered the immortal Juche idea and, on this basis, comprehensively systemized and evolved the original theories on national and class liberation and socialist construction, thus performing undying ideo-theoretical feats in the development of the socialist cause and the human cause of independence.
					
					The socialist cause of Korea pioneered by him is making long strides under the distinguished Songun revolutionary guidance of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					To significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun in 2012, the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung, the peerlessly great man, on a global scale is the unanimous desire of the world progressive people boundlessly revering and ardently yearning for him who dedicated all his life to the socialist cause, the human cause of independence.
					
					With the friendly Korean people, political parties and organizations of many countries are now conducting the brisk preparations on a worldwide scale to splendidly commemorate this meaningful Day of the Sun, and this atmosphere is running higher.
					
					Expressing full support and solidarity with the WPK and the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving socialist nation, we ardently call on the political parties and organizations of all countries to commemorate as a grand political festival common to humankind the 100th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung who made immortal contribution to the human cause of independence.

articles.title: WPK and Korean People's Struggle Supported by Int'l Meeting
articles.content:
WPK and Korean People's Struggle Supported by Int'l Meeting

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The 13th International Meeting of Communist and Workers' Parties, held in Greece from Dec. 9 to 11, expressed full support and solidarity with the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					A resolution adopted at the meeting said that the Korean people set a grand goal for building a thriving socialist nation and are pushing forward the general offensive for its materialization under the leadership of the WPK. It went on:
					
					The WPK called for effecting a decisive turn in building an economic power and improving the standard of people's living by giving spur to the light industry again while consolidating the position of a politico-ideological and military power already built, this significant year reviewing the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					In response to this militant call, the Korean people have speeded up the general advance for improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation under the slogan "Korea Does What It Is Determined to Do!"
					
					The WPK has reliably defended the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia, shattering the moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK. It is now playing a big role in realizing the cause of socialism, the human cause of independence.
					
					The Korean people will surely emerge victorious in the just cause of defending the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and opening the gate to a thriving nation as there is the wise guidance of the WPK with leader Kim Jong Il as its general secretary.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Dec. 8 and 10 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					They included a meeting in Switzerland, lectures and film shows in Brazil, Guinea and Nigeria and an international Taekwon-Do tournament in Bulgaria.
					
					Displayed at their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos on their feats and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					Korean films shown included "Reply of Korea" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee said in a speech that Kim Jong Il has strengthened the Korean People's Army into the invincible revolutionary armed forces defending socialism as firm as a rock.
					
					Under his Songun revolutionary leadership the DPRK has turned into a nuclear state and a military power no one dares provoke, the speaker added.
					
					The chairman of the Santa Catarina State Committee of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil said that Kim Il Sung is the great leader and benevolent father of the Korean people as he devoted his all to the country and the people, regarding it as his maxim to believe in the people as in Heaven.
					
					The desire of Kim Il Sung is being translated into brilliant reality by Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					December 24 is the birthday of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, the chairman said, adding: We pay our heartfelt tribute to her who provided firm guarantee for carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche through generations in the DPRK.
					
					The chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea said that the two decades since Kim Jong Il's assumption of KPA supreme commandership were the days during which it has been proved that he is the peerlessly brilliant commander.
					
					A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Switzerland.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Feats and Trait Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Feats and Trait Praised Abroad

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Nepal and India dedicated special write-ups to the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					The Nepali paper Janmabhumi on Dec. 10 carried an article titled "Her Desire" with a picture of Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu. The article said:
					
					The desire of Kim Jong Suk was in a word to build a rich and powerful country, where the people lead a happy life, in Korea true to the cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					She devoted her all to the country and the people till the last moments of her life since she embarked upon the road of revolution to liberate Korea from the military occupation by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					What she desired so ardently is now being translated into a reality thanks to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Signal successes are being made in the DPRK day by day, the paper said, adding this shows that the desire of Kim Jong Suk deeply revered by the Korean people is being successfully realized.
					
					Nepal's other paper Nepal Today on Dec. 12 carried a photo of Kim Jong Suk and an article praising the feats of her who dedicated all her life to the women's emancipation.
					
					The Indian paper India Europe News and Information Bureau on Dec. 12 carried an article saying that Kim Jong Suk devoted her all to comrades and people.

articles.title: Russian Lawmakers Reject European Parliament’s Resolution
articles.content:
Russian Lawmakers Reject European Parliament’s Resolution

					Moscow, December 17 (KCNA) -- Lawmakers of Russia on Dec. 14 rejected the resolution of the European Parliament on the election of the State Duma in Russia.
					
					Recently the European Parliament adopted a resolution calling for declaring the results of the election of the State Duma null and void.
					
					In this regard the first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia in a press conference labeled it a shameless insult to the electors of Russia and an undisguised interference in its internal affairs.
					
					Leonid Slutski, deputy to the State Duma, said that the European Parliament has always applied double standards and put forward the outdated scenarios, strongly urging it to stop such act of destroying the bilateral relations.
					
					Deputies to the State Duma from the Liberal Democratic Party in a statement resolutely rejected all the impudent assertions of the European Parliament to interfere in Russia's political affairs.
					
					Condemning the pressure and interference in the internal affairs of a sovereign state as a provocation, the statement said any attempt to impose the standard of European "democracy upon Russia" would face the most resolute counterattack.

articles.title: Iran Calls on Neighbors Not to Allow Misuse of Airspace against Iran: FM
articles.content:
Iran Calls on Neighbors Not to Allow Misuse of Airspace against Iran: FM

					Tehran, December 17 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi on Thursday called on Iran's neighbors not to allow their space to be misused against the country, the official IRNA news agency reported.
					
					Salehi called the recent incursion of the U.S. spy drone into its airspace "an act of hostility and encroachment," said the report.

articles.title: Palestinian Leadership Condemns Jewish Settlers over Torching Mosque
articles.content:
Palestinian Leadership Condemns Jewish Settlers over Torching Mosque

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian leadership condemned some Jewish settlers who set fire to a mosque in the West Bank early Thursday.
					
					After setting fire to the third floor of a mosque in a village near the West Bank city of Ramallah, the settlers left slogans against Palestinians written with spray paints. This is the second such violence in 24 hours. On Wednesday, some settlers burnt the entrance of an abandoned mosque in East Jerusalem.
					
					"Vandalizing holy sites is a declaration of war by settlers against the Palestinian people," said Nabil Abu Rdineh, spokesperson for the Palestinian leadership.
					
					He called on the Israeli government to curb the settlers' violence.

articles.title: U.S. Must Apologize to Iran for Sending Stealth Spying Aircraft: Pakistani Lawmaker
articles.content:
U.S. Must Apologize to Iran for Sending Stealth Spying Aircraft: Pakistani Lawmaker

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani lawmaker said on Thursday that the U.S. administration should apologize to Iran for violating Iranian airspace by sending advanced stealth reconnaissance aircraft. 
					
					Talking to IRNA, Senator Raja Muhammad Zafar-ul-Haq said that there is no justification of such act and Iran has taken a right decision to bring down the American spy drone. 
					
					He acknowledged the remarks of Iran's Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani that United States must be held accountable for venturing to fly spy drone over Iranian territory. 
					
					Larijani said that the Americans must give explanations for sending stealth reconnaissance aircraft over Iranian territory rather than ask the return of the drone.

articles.title: Mauritius Adopts Law against Maritime Piracy
articles.content:
Mauritius Adopts Law against Maritime Piracy

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The Mauritius parliament on Wednesday unanimously adopted, with an amendment, a law meant to fight against maritime piracy.
					
					Piracy in the Indian Ocean had reached worrying proportions, Prime Minister Navin Ramgoolam said, justifying the adoption of the new legislation.
					
					He announced the construction of a special prison for pirates who will be arrested, charged and sentenced to imprisonment in Mauritius.

articles.title: Top Palestinian Envoy Calls Israeli's Settlement Expansion "Incendiary, Illegal"
articles.content:
Top Palestinian Envoy Calls Israeli's Settlement Expansion "Incendiary, Illegal"

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The permanent observer of Palestine to the UN in a recent letter addressed to the UN secretary general scathingly accused Israel’s illegal act.
					
					He said Israel's approval of new settlement activities in East Kuds and the West Bank are "incendiary and illegal actions" to divide Palestine. 
					
					He also pointed to the escalation of military assaults and human rights violations by Israel, which he said has caused the "rapid rise of tensions and instability on the ground." He called upon the international community to put pressure on Israel to stop the construction of settlements and repressive acts.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Papua New Guinea
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Papua New Guinea

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- A 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit Papua New Guinea on Dec. 14.
					
					The epicenter was the eastern area of New Guinea Island.

articles.title: Lots of Unreported Nuclear Substances Found in Japan
articles.content:
Lots of Unreported Nuclear Substances Found in Japan

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed in Japan that lots of nuclear substances were unreported to the International Atomic Energy Agency, touching off great furor.
					
					2.8 kg of highly-enriched uranium and four tons of lowly-enriched uranium were found unmeasured each at an institute under the government control and a nuclear fuel manufacturing enterprise, according to Tokyo Shimbun on Dec. 15 which quoted a government survey data on at least 260 nuclear facilities across the country, the objects of IAEA inspection.
					
					It has been also known that a large amount of nuclear substances were not measured at Jyubu, Hokuriku and Jyugoku electric power companies. So the work to confirm the facts is reportedly under way.
					
					In this regard the government started negotiations in secrecy while making haste with report on them to the IAEA in a bid to avoid the accusations of the international community, the paper said.

articles.title: Census Shows 1 in 2 People Are Poor or Low-Income in U.S.
articles.content:
Census Shows 1 in 2 People Are Poor

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The livelihood of Americans is getting more serious due to the unpopular policy of the authorities and the aftermath of the economic financial crisis.
					
					About 97.3 million Americans fall into a low-income category, the Census Bureau of the U.S. said recently.

articles.title: U.S. Current Account Deficit
articles.content:
U.S. Current Account Deficit

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The current U.S. account trade deficit amounted to 110.3 billion U.S. dollars in the third quarter, the Commerce Department reported Thursday.

articles.title: Serious U.S. Jobless
articles.content:
Serious U.S. Joblessness

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- The advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits in the country was 366 000 in the week ending Dec. 10, the Labor Department of the U.S. reported Thursday.

articles.title: Street Shooting Injures 2 in Germany
articles.content:
Street Shooting Injures 2 in Germany

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- Two people were critically injured in a rampant shooting by unidentified criminals in the city of Bottrop in western Germany on Thursday.

articles.title: NZ Manufacturing Continues Decline
articles.content:
NZ Manufacturing Continues Decline

					Pyongyang, December 18 (KCNA) -- New Zealand's manufacturing sector contracted further last month, according to the latest performance of manufacturing index (PMI) released Thursday.
					
					The BNZ-Business New Zealand PMI for November was 45.7, down from 46.6 in October and an average of 51.4 for the first 11 months of the year.
